entry.title: Yessenia and her husband Carlos are selling smothered burritos...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Yessenia and her husband Carlos are selling smothered burritos and flan this weekend! If you’ve been looking for vegetarian green chile, don’t miss it. Order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

entry.title: 10 years back stop same place justice for Alonzo Ashley
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

10 years back stop same place justice for Alonzo Ashley

Ten years after Alonzo Ashley was killed by Denver police at the Denver Zoo, the zoo dedicated a water fountain and cooling station in his name as part of a restorative justice agreement with his f…

denverpost.com

“We are really sorry”: 10 years after a man lost his life at the hands of police at the Denver Zoo, an apology comes

Ten years after Alonzo Ashley was killed by Denver police at the Denver Zoo, the zoo dedicated a water fountain and cooling station in his name as part of a restorative justice agreement with his f…Ten years after Alonzo Ashley was killed by Denver police at the Denver Zoo, the zoo dedicated a water fountain and cooling station in his name as part of a restorative justice agreement with his f…

entry.title: 10 years ago, we were honoring the life of Alonzo Ashely. Today...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

10 years ago, we were honoring the life of Alonzo Ashely. Today we come back to the same place to keep honoring his life and supporting his family. It doesn’t matter how much time passes by, we will keep remembering the life of every person of color, black and brown, that has been killed in the hands of police. One day we will end with this practice of abuse, creating legislations to take away the protection of all those corrupt police officers that think that just because they have a badge, it gives them permission to kill our people. Marking the life of families, we will keep marching in the streets to end police brutality.

entry.title: I’m a third generation survivor 🧡 - Every child matters...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

I’m a third generation survivor 🧡

-

Every child matters 🧡

...

Today is the Day for Truth and Reconciliation, also known as Orange Shirt Day. If you’re an Indigenous ally, take this day [and every day] to learn more about the historical and current realities of Indigenous Peoples 🪶

-

For content on Residential Schools, visit the following sites:

https://legacyofhope.ca

https://nctr.ca/…/teaching-reso…/residential-school-history/

https://education.afn.ca/…/learning-mo…/residential-schools/

-

#EveryChildMatters #ResidentialSchools #TruthBeforeReconciliation #OrangeShirtDay #MoreThanOneDay

entry.title: I’m a third generation survivor 🧡 - Every child matters...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

I’m a third generation survivor 🧡

-

Every child matters 🧡

...

Today is the Day for Truth and Reconciliation, also known as Orange Shirt Day. If you’re an Indigenous ally, take this day [and every day] to learn more about the historical and current realities of Indigenous Peoples 🪶

-

For content on Residential Schools, visit the following sites:

https://legacyofhope.ca

https://nctr.ca/…/teaching-reso…/residential-school-history/

https://education.afn.ca/…/learning-mo…/residential-schools/

-

#EveryChildMatters #ResidentialSchools #TruthBeforeReconciliation #OrangeShirtDay #MoreThanOneDay

See More

entry.title: Abolish ICE DenverAn Aurora Police officer has been placed on paid administrative leave following the release of body camera footage showing...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE DenverAn Aurora Police officer has been placed on paid administrative leave following the release of body camera footage showing a traffic stop that turned violent.

thedenverchannel.com

Body camera footage shows Aurora officers tackling, using Taser on man

An Aurora Police officer has been placed on paid administrative leave following the release of body camera footage showing a traffic stop that turned violent.An Aurora Police officer has been placed on paid administrative leave following the release of body camera footage showing a traffic stop that turned violent.

entry.title: Hello Denver and beyond, please make sure you mark your...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Hello Denver and beyond, please make sure you mark your calendar‘s for this Friday, October 1 from 4 to 6 PM.

Here is what happened:
Alanzo Ashley was at the zoo with his family in 2011. This man began to visibly display symptoms of heat stroke￼￼￼. Alonzo should have been treated with medical care by Zoo staff and any other responding personnel, instead Denver police were called and when they arrived they tackled him and used a taser when they did not need to and as a result... his heart stopped.

Who took responsibility:
After a 10 year up hill battle with no one from the city or the zoo even offering as little as an apology to the family in the mourning or a community in outrage￼. After a law suit and many years of protesting outside of the zoo, after distributing water bottles and information regarding what happened.￼￼

October 1st from 4:00 - 6:00:
The zoo staff coordinated by Dr. Mosby Tyler have been working with ￼the family, around the development of a water fountain and cooling station in memory of Alonzo Ashley. This memorial will be unveiled this Friday, October 1 between 4 PM and 6 PM. Friends Family and Community are welcome￼￼, Zoo admission will be free to those who attend.

Link to event here:

https://facebook.com/events/s/in-memory-of-alonzo-ashley/541435653623950/
